name: Speaking Up: Surviving Religions and Cults

episodes.title: NEW PODCASTS
episodes.description: Speaking Up has ended, but I have two new podcasts out now. My new podcasts are ' Surviving BJU: A Christian Cult' and ' Beyond BJU: Exposing Fundamentalism '. “ Surviving Bob Jones University: A Christian Cult ” is a limited podcast by Andrew Pledger. The show is a thought-provoking podcast that explores the fundamentalist Christian college BJU, which is located in Greenville, SC. The series covers the history of BJU, the psychology of fundamentalism, the criteria for cults, and survivors experiences. This limited series also features cult experts who offer their opinions on the university. ( Beyond BJU: Exposing Fundamentalism ) Join Andrew Pledger in exposing Bob Jones University, a school known for its culture of indoctrination and control. BJU is a fundamentalist Christian college with roots in white supremacy and authoritarianism. The podcast features survivors' stories from the university, and its affiliated churches, camps, and day schools. The show also explores BJU's influence beyond the university, focusing on Christian education, politics, Biblical counseling, and evangelical Christianity. This show is a continuation of the limited series "Surviving BJU: A Christian Cult.” CHECK OUT MY NEW PODCASTS: https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/beyond-bju-podcast/ Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: Finale

episodes.title: SAFER - Laura Padgett & Jenni Espinosa
episodes.description: Laura Padgett & Jenni Espinosa - Abuse Recovery Coaches, Policy Consultants, Domestic Violence AdvocatesLaura holds nearly two decades of public policy advocacy and cross-cultural ministry leadership experience. She has turned her passion for helping others heal into abuse recovery coaching through body-mind wellness, mindfulness, and therapeutic arts modalities.Jenni has devoted over 20 years of her life as an amazing educator and now has turned that devotion and experience toward domestic violence advocacy and abuse recovery. She holds a master's degree and deep expertise in church ministry leadership and navigating divorce.As abuse recovery coaches, both Laura and Jenni meet clients with compassionate wisdom learned through professional training, as well as many years of reclaiming their own lives from toxicity and abuse. Connect with them on their website, Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: When Religion Hurts You - Dr. Laura Anderson
episodes.description: Dr. Laura Anderson is a therapist, trauma resolution and recovery coach, writer, educator, and creator who specializes in complex trauma with a focus on domestic violence, sexualized violence and religious trauma. She holds a Master’s degree in Marriage and Family Therapy and a PhD in Mind Body Medicine from Saybrook University with her research focusing on the experience of living in a healing body after sexual trauma. Laura has a private practice in Nashville, TN and is the founder and director of the Center for Trauma Resolution and Recovery, an online coaching company where she and the other practitioners work with clients who have experienced high demand/high control religions, adverse religious experiences, cults, and religious trauma. Her Book: Book | Religious Trauma Expert (drlauraeanderson.com)In 2019, Laura co-founded the Religious Trauma Institute with the goal of providing trauma-informed resources, consultation, and training to clinicians and other helping professionals who work with religious trauma survivors. Laura’s first book, “When Religion Hurts You: Healing From Religious Trauma and the Impact of High Control Religion”, is being released by Brazos press in Fall 2023. She lives with her dog, Phoebe, in Nashville, Tennessee.Connect with Dr. Laura Anderson on Instagram, and Tik Tok, Andrew's LinksBecome a Patreon member HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/links Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: Stumbling - Brandon Flanery

He’s been featured in Baptist News Global, the Colorado Springs Indy, and with the University of Colorado. His new book Stumbling: a sassy memoir about coming out of Evangelicalism debuts August 22 and is available for pre-order. You can learn more about Brandon and his writings by going to BrandonFlanery.com.Order his book: https://brandonflanery.com/book/Linkree: https://brandonflanery.com/link-tree/Andrew's LinksBecome a Patreon member HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/links Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Leaving the PCG - Hannah Strickland - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Hannah Strickland grew up in the PCG from birth until the age of 15. The organization seemed truly malevolent to them, as it appeared to exploit the less fortunate to provide a lavish lifestyle for the leadership and their headquarters family. Over time, many from their generation decided to leave, but their family, with the exception of their mother, remained entrenched in the cult. The PCG functioned as a doomsday cult, fixated on the imminent return of Christ, using fear as a tool to enforce compliance and belief in their fabricated beliefs.Become a Patreon member HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/links Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Surviving BJU: A Christian Cult - Trailer #2
episodes.description: Subscribe here to Surviving BJU: https://lnk.bio/survivingbjupod"Surviving Bob Jones University: A Christian Cult” is a limited podcast by Andrew Pledger (COMING AUGUST 23, 2023). The show is a thought-provoking podcast series that explores the history of Bob Jones University, the psychology of fundamentalism, the criteria for cults, and survivors experiences. The series features diverse interviews with survivors, including queer individuals, BIPOC, women, and men, sharing their unique perspectives on the institution. Listeners gain insight into the strict rules, culture, and leadership of Bob Jones University and how its fundamentalist beliefs have contributed to a toxic environment. The podcast showcases stories of resilience, healing, and growth from survivors who have overcome trauma and abuse at the Christian college. It offers an eye-opening exploration of cults’ harmful impact on vulnerable individuals and communities. SUBSCRIBE to stay updated on the premiere of this podcast which is coming August 23, 2023.  Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: 007 - Silenced in Eden - Jo Lloyd Johnson
episodes.description: Jo Lloyd Johnson is a childhood sexual abuse survivor and deconverted Christian who just published her first book “Silenced in Eden.” Her book walks readers through her childhood, the realization of her repressed abuse, and the journey to begin healing. Her path to self-love and acceptance was her journey out of religion. Order her book here: https://www.amazon.com/Silenced-Eden-Jo-Lloyd-Johnson/dp/B0BV4GMV1MBecome a Patreon member HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/links Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: 006 - From Skepticism to Acceptance - Kristina Mand-Lakhiani
episodes.description: Kristina Mand-Lakhiani is an international speaker, entrepreneur, artist, philanthropist, and mother of 2 kids. As a co-founder of Mindvalley, a leading publisher in the personal growth industry, Kristina dedicated the last 20 years of her career from teachers like Michael Beckwith, Bob Proctor, Lisa Nichols, and many more. She started her career in a government office in her native Estonia and, by her mid-20s, achieved a level of success mostly known to male politicians at the end of their careers. It was shortly after that Kristina and her then-husband Vishen founded Mindvalley. From a small meditation business operating out of the couple’s apartment in New York, the company quickly grew into a global educational organization offering top training for peak human performance to hundreds of thousands of students all around the world. Kristina believes life is too important to be taken seriously and makes sure to bring fun into every one of her roles: as a teacher, mother, entrepreneur, philanthropist, and world traveller. Kristina helps her students to virtually hack happiness by taking them through her unique framework - “Hacking happiness” - a unique framework of balancing your life, taking in every moment, and paying close attention to the small daily choices.  Kristina is also the author of three transformational quests - "7 Days To Happiness", "Live By Your Own Rules.” and "The Art of Being Flawesome". Kristina talks about personal transformation, authenticity, understanding and accepting oneself, and a path to happiness.In July 2023, with the help of Hay House Publishing, Kristina releases her very first book - "Becoming Flawesome". In her book, Kristina shares her own journey from being on top of a personal growth empire like Mindvalley to stepping aside, conscious uncoupling from her husband, and walking her path towards being more honest with herself. You can find more information about Kristina here: Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, and website. https://kristinamand.com/Becoming Flawesome: https://www.amazon.com/Becoming-Flawesome-Living-Imperfectly-Authentic/dp/1401974341Support Andrew's work on Patreon HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/links Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: What is Truth? - PATREON BONUS PREVIEW
episodes.description: Listen to the full episode on my Patreon HERE: https://patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerIn this thought-provoking episode, we explore the significance, enigmatic nature, and profound impact that truth has on our understanding of the world. I dig into the psychology of mankind's search for truth, and how cults prey on this drive. Join me as I draw from the wisdom of ancient thinkers and modern philosophers to navigate the various theories of truth. Together, we will examine the notions of correspondence, coherence, and pragmatism, seeking to grasp the essence of what it truly means for a statement or belief to be considered true. We'll ponder the timeless questions: Can truth be objective, or is it a subjective construct? Does absolute truth exist, or is truth merely a product of our interpretations?Join Andrew's Patreon HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. https://andrewpledger.mypixieset.com/links Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

She believes in approaching faith with critical thinking and open-mindedness. To read her blog or learn more about her and her platform, check out her website HaleyTheScientist.com. Or, check out her podcast Divinely Modern, which offers support and conversations for exploring faith in the modern world and finding divinity all around us.Connect with Haley through her websiteSupport Andrew's work on Patreon HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. episodes.title: 004 - Crucifying the Bible - Deborah Grace
episodes.description: Deborah Grace spent the better part of her life writing for the legitimacy of the scriptures, but it was in those writings that the truth began to surface. Having been told numerous times over the years that she would one day write a book, Crucifying the Bible is her first published book and the last point of contention she ever imagined taking on. Although controversial, Grace found the process to be cathartic and another layer of closure to her past journey in faith; healing many old wounds inflicted by religion and finding a sense of validation as she connected with others who shared similar stories in her research. Deborah is currently writing her second book.As an INTJ, she is careful with her choices, detailed in her work, introspective in her personal growth, and strives to finish strong. Her tagline is to be a better person today than yesterday and an even better person tomorrow than today.Deborah with her husband Mark and Yorkie Tank in Georgia. In her spare time, and in addition to writing, she enjoys learning new things, traveling with her husband, and a good glass of Italian wine. Buy Crucifying the BibleConnect with Deborah GraceWebsite, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and YouTubeSupport Andrew's work on Patreon HERE and access all bonus episodes + other benefits. https://www.patreon.com/4ndrewpledgerConnect with Andrew Pledger through social media, and his website. Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: 002 - From the Children of God to the Military - Daniella Mestyanek Young
episodes.description: DANIELLA MESTYANEK YOUNG is an American author and speaker who was raised in the religious cult, Children of God. She later served as an intelligence officer for the US Army for over six years, making the rank of Captain, and became one of the first women in US Army history to conduct deliberate ground combat operations when she volunteered to serve on a Female Engagement Team and received the Presidential Volunteer Service Award. Daniella lives with her husband and daughter in Maryland and holds a Master’s degree in Industrial and Organizational Psychology from the Harvard Extension School.Buy Daniella's memoir UnculturedConnect with Daniella on Instagram, Twitter and TikTokConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Asleep to My Own Magic - Nicole Zell - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Singer-Songwriter Nicole Zell has finally found her voice on debut album, Asleep To My Own Magic, undoubtedly her most mature, enlightened work yet. After achieving minor success throughout her twenties such as touring nationally with American Wolves, fronting THRILLCHASER, co-billing with acts such as KT Tunstall and Vanessa Carlton, and being featured on numerous press outlets such as Billboard, Fuse TV, and TODAY with Hoda and Jenna, Nicole took a step back to "evaluate my position around the age of 27" as she sings in "7 Years" - a song penned as an apology for not believing in her younger self. For an artist who was timid to release solo music for years, Nicole holds nothing back on this album. In songs like "Cycle", Zell dares to confront generational cycles, childhood abuse, her religious upbringing, and even god himself. As the story reaches an end, it becomes apparent that Zell has tapped into the ability to turn darkness into light, struggle into success, trauma into triumph, and mayhem into magic. In "Magic", the closing song on the album, Nicole can be heard joyfully singing a healing affirmation alongside a celestial choir, "I am safe, I am loved, I am healing, I am light . . . because I am the magic."Listen to Nicole Zell's Music on Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube, or BandCampFollow Nicole on Instagram, and check out her LinktreeConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.description: Cynane, a nuclear engineer in SC, escaped a special brand of Floridian white Christian nationalism. Her childhood normalized conspiracy theories, but 2020, with COVID and Q4n0n, finally made her realize something was deeply wrong. Now Cynane is writing a book, “Taking Off the Tinfoil Hat,” to process the deconstruction of her fundamentalist evangelicalism and propagandistic patriotism. From the IBLP cult to Jewish space lasers, she pulled the thread and cracked her faith.Connect with CynaneInstagram WebsiteConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: The Recipe for an Abusive Relationship - Sarah Van Etten Leupold - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Sarah Van Etten Leupold was raised in a conservative Evangelical non-denominational church. When she started to explore her beliefs she was spiritually abused and rejected from her church. As a result she has received a complex PTSD diagnosis. She has struggled with gender dysphoria and identifies as a queer woman. The spiritual abuse led to an abusive marriage and a divorce and years later her faith fell apart due to the church's response to her fiance's death. Today Sarah spends a lot of her free time writing about religious trauma as a way to support other survivors.Connect with SarahHer BlogConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Consciousness and Trauma - Blaise Kennedy - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: About Blaise KennedyEverything exists within my consciousness. My body sits at the very centre of this reality. I live within my body, and my body lives within my consciousness. The purpose of my life is to bring coherence to the inner and outer lives of all beings, so that they may know themselves as the source of their consciousness. Blaise's work is the result of his personal transformation, which began in 2010 when he checked into a drug rehabilitation centre. At 24 years old, and after many years of avoidance, struggle, and difficulty, Blaise was finally ready to face reality. After 5 months of treatment Blaise saw tremendous benefits in every area of his life and experience. He left the treatment centre with one question. “How far and how deep can I take this?” How much transformation is possible? Every moment since then has been the fulfillment, the living answer to his question. Today Blaise shares the most valuable and essential elements of awakening and healing, so that you too may know how far and how deep your life can go.Connect with Blaise KennedyYouTubeLinktree Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite  Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

episodes.title: Healing Through Humor - Shannon Payton (Shanny Pants) - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Shannon Payton, known as Shanny Pants by many, is a content creator and podcaster living in Rocklin, California. Her podcast, "The Shanny Pants Show" is currently in its third season. In her interview-style podcast, Shannon shares her struggles of growing up in a cult, battles through years of infertility that ended in a hysterectomy, and finally her journey to parenthood through foster care and adoption. Shannon has been a guest on The Kelly Clarkson show and has appeared on local TV show GoodDay Sacramento multiple times. She enjoys sharing the struggles of life in a humorous way as part of her self-prescribed therapy and through this, has connected with her fans.Connect with Shannon PaytonInstagramTikTokYouTubeWebsitePodcastConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite  Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Intersexion - Cynthia Vacca Davis - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Cynthia Vacca Davis is a semi-salty adjunct English professor with a trunk full of papers and snack wrappers. She holds an MFA in creative nonfiction, leads writing workshops, and has written hundreds of feature stories, and two independently published YA novels. She's the author of Intersexion: a Story of Faith, Identity, and Authenticity from Lake Drive BooksBook Description: "Sometimes in life we reach an intersection where we must pick either safety or stepping into life as our true selves. It’s a moment of courage, vision, and finding our voice.Cynthia, an adjunct professor with a trunk full of ungraded papers and snack wrappers, has been an LGBTQIA+ ally for years—in convenient ways. She enjoys the company of her queer friends—but her support isn’t risky; it hasn’t cost her anything. Until she meets Danny. The youngest child in a conservative religious family, Danny played the role of dutiful daughter—Dani, with an “i”—which was safer than jeopardizing faith and family. Seemingly born female, yet desperate to be seen as the boy and then man he is, Danny kept playing along, until his life and health depended on one thing: the truth.Told in both Danny’s and Cynthia’s voices, Intersexion is a moving, hopeful exploration of the cost of being known—as an intersex minority, ally, or asker of difficult questions—and what it means to come into one’s own. It’s a book for anyone craving a more authentic life. It’s a story about the intersections we find ourselves in by no choice of our own, and the life-giving choices we can make.Named on the Top 34 LGTBQ Christian Books of 2022 by Q Spirit"Connect with Cynthia Vacca DavisBookLinktreeInstagramConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite  Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Ministry, Manipulation and MLMs! Oh My! - Hollyanne Simon - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Hollyanne Simon did not grow up in the Church but made it her life beginning at age 13. She accepted Jesus in a moment of "worship" at a Summer Camp, and when coming back home, she dove head first into all things Church. She began volunteering in the Children's Ministry, on the worship team, and in the office. By the age of 16, she was working in the Church as a Children's ministry intern, and worship intern, which later turned into full-time ministry positions. She worked on Church staff for a decade, six of those years being pastoral. episodes.title: Church Sanctioned Abuse - Tia Levings - ARCHIVE

Her work explores the female narrative in patriarchal spaces. She has a memoir releasing in 2024 through St. Martin's Press.Her videos on social media have millions of views. Through the lens of her personal experience, she connects entertainment, news headlines, and current events to fundamentalist influences and strategy. She writes about religious trauma and Christian fundamentalism to educate, validate, and empower those who feel smashed by the patriarchy. She does it to create something beautiful from pain.And, because when she went through the hell of church-sanctioned violence, she felt alone. She wants you to know you aren’t alone. episodes.title: Divorcing Religion - Janice Selbie - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Janice Selbie was raised evangelical and turned to closed Mennonite (Holdeman/Church of God in Christ Mennonite) during her husband's bible college years. She homeschooled her children, wore a head covering, and was very conservative. Her marriage was difficult and got harder as the years went on. Eventually, they had a series of tragedies strike that she could not explain if there was indeed a loving or omniscient God. This plunged her into a time of existential crisis. She divorced her husband and religion, went back to school to become a registered professional counselor, and connected with Dr. Marlene Winell who coined the term Religious Trauma (Dr. Winell is now her friend and mentor). Then she founded the Conference on Religious Trauma (CORT) and this October the Shameless Sexuality: Life After Purity Culture online conference.Fight for Children's Rights: Congress Needs to Pass Children's Rights ActConnect with Janice SelbieHer Podcast: https://www.divorcing-religion.com/religious-trauma-podcastWebsite: https://www.divorcing-religion.comIG: https://instagram.com/wisecounsellor?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@janiceselbie?_t=8UZKbpvXcHG&_r=1Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: As Familiar As Family - Nicki Pappas - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Nicki Pappas comes back on the show to talk about her memoir, As Familiar As Family. I experienced abuse as love from a young age. In As Familiar as Family, I explore and examine the ways in which I was groomed for unhealthy relationships and toxic religion.Book Description by Nicki Pappas I experienced abuse as love from a young age. In As Familiar as Family, I explore and examine the ways in which I was groomed for unhealthy relationships and toxic religion. This book chronicles my journey to find my voice — and a way out — which began once I understood how the spiritual abuse, power dynamics, narcissism, and emotional detachment in the church were as familiar as family. episodes.description: TRIGGER WARNING - This episode mentions trauma, sexual abuse, and other hard topics.Isami Daehn was born in Japan and eventually moved to the US. She was raised by fake missionaries who stole money from churches under the guise of “missionary” work. Isami grew up in the IFB cult and regularly experienced verbal, physical, sexual, and spiritual abuse. For years, she was trafficked by her mother. Isami recounts how her mother would bring her to a piano teacher who would sexually assault her every week. Isami talks about the work she’s doing now due to her childhood. She’s a speaker who brings awareness to trafficking, sexual abuse, and how to see the warning signs. She speaks at churches, schools, and other venues. episodes.title: Why I Became a Cult Expert - Rachel Bernstein LMFT - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Rachel Bernstein, therapist, and world-renowned cult expert shares her story for the first time. Rachel is the host of the “IndoctriNation” podcast. For 30 years, she has helped former cult members and those who have loved ones in cults and highly manipulative relationships. Rachel has helped people from over 300 cults throughout her career. She provides individual counseling, family counseling, and, when possible, group therapy for former cult members. She also helps families trying to reach out to their loved ones in the cult.She has led workshops and classes at USC in the School of Social Work and the Department of Psychiatry, at California State University at Northridge, and at various colleges and universities in the New York area. She is also a yearly presenter at the International Cultic Studies Association conferences and was a guest lecturer for the Clergy Emergency League and Wisconsin Council of Churches. She has presented at the Pacific Rim Conference for people in Australia, New Zealand, Japan, South Korea, and China who are affected by cults and relationships with narcissists, and, with colleagues, developed the program "Stronger After", a free 5-session program for initial support and education for people newly out of highly controlling, abusive, and restrictive environments.Connect with Rachel BernsteinHer Podcast: https://open.spotify.com/show/1prXo4iIxUfjYpfX671cUD?si=KOWPMrAsROyysB1vXNu3dwSupport Her Work: https://www.patreon.com/indoctrination?utm_campaign=creatorshare_fanLinktree: https://linktr.ee/indoctrinationIG: https://instagram.com/indoctrinationpodcast?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Cult Awareness Month - Janja Lalich - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Janja Lalich, Ph.D., Professor Emerita of Sociology, is an international authority on cults and coercion. Researcher, author, and educator, she specializes in recruitment, indoctrination, and methods of influence and control. She has been studying the social psychology of controversial groups and abusive relationships for 35 years. Dr. Lalich is the author and/or coauthor of six books, including the classic Take Back Your Life: Recovering from Cults and Abusive Relationships, and Escaping Utopia: Growing Up in a Cult, Getting Out and Starting Over. Her book Bounded Choice: True Believers and Charismatic Cults has been recognized as the first original theoretical contribution to the field of cultic studies in decades. In addition to working with survivors and their families, she leads workshops and educational sessions for government agencies, international intelligence agencies, private companies, educational institutions, nonprofit organizations, and leads online psychoeducational courses for trauma survivors, families, and mental-health professionals. She has also served as an expert witness in civil and criminal legal cases. A frequent keynoter or presenter at domestic and international conferences, her work has been translated into German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, Turkish, Russian, Serbo-Croatian, and Polish, and many other languages.Connect with Janja LalichWebsite: https://janjalalich.com/Books: https://janjalalich.com/blog/category/books/Cult Education: https://janjalalich.com/blog/category/cults-the-basics/Cult Awareness Month Information: https://internationalcultawareness.org/Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Rethinking Jesus - Danny Daniels - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Danny was a Bible believing Christian with an instilled fear of not questioning adopted beliefs but by his mid-forties Christianity wasn’t working so he left the church and Jesus. He started exploring eastern religions, new age, yoga, meditation, and Shamanism. He runs a YT channel called “Rethinking Jesus” where he challenges the narrative of Jesus and Christianity presented to us. Danny has discovered through his deconstruction that Jesus and Christianity is an invention to control people. CONNECT WITH DANNY - YouTube (https://youtu.be/_paEE0610oU)Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Burn the Patriarchy - Nicki Pappas - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Nicki Pappas is an emerging writer currently working on her first memoir, As Familiar As Family. In the book, she talks about how she was groomed for toxic religion and how she escaped. In August of 2020, she started the “Broadening the Narrative” podcast where she talks with people who are broadening narrow narratives she learned in evangelicalism. She experienced many kinds of abuse growing up and was spiritually abused at her church. Let’s welcome Nicki. - CONNECT WITH NICKI - Instagram (https://instagram.com/broadeningthenarrative?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=) - Blog (http://broadeningthenarrative.blogspot.com/2018/01/why-should-we-broaden-narrative.html?m=1) Tik Tok (https://vm.tiktok.com/ZTdVcBhBF/) Linktree (https://linktr.ee/broadeningthenarrative)Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: What is Religious Trauma? - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Religious Trauma Syndrome (RTS) is a group of symptoms that arise in response to traumatic or stressful religious experiences. Learn More Here. (Source: Religious Trauma & Transitions — RESTORATION COUNSELING (restorationcounselingseattle.com)Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: Queer and Christian - Brandan Robertson - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: Brandan Robertson is a progressive gay Christian minister and activist. He helps those from traumatic religious backgrounds rethink what faith and spirituality can look like. His biggest platform is TikTok where he engages regularly with questions. He has been featured on the GMA website and Rolling Stone Magazine. He is also an author that addresses Christianity and LGBTQIA+ issues. Brandan is speaking up by using his story to help LGBTQ+ youth. Connect with Brandan RobertsonInstagram https://instagram.com/brandanrobertson?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y= Tik Tok - https://vm.tiktok.com/ZTdXK4rdW/ YouTube - https://youtube.com/channel/UCxgWtkq0pgBhBeSwwCGTNTA Twitter - https://twitter.com/brandanjr?s=21&t=jAS5wExnXpvfNmlKmm3fJg Website - https://www.brandanrobertson.comConnect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. episodes.title: My Story - IFB Cult - Andrew Pledger - ARCHIVE
episodes.description: My name is Andrew Pledger and this is my story. I grew up in the IFB cult and was homeschooled my whole life. I ended up attending Bob Jones University for several years and was expelled before graduation. The expulsion was a result of sharing my story publicly. I'm a religious trauma survivor who brings awareness to RT, spiritual abuse, and mental health. Being a part of the LGBTQ+ community, and experiencing religious trauma has inspired me to pursue psychology to help survivors of religious abuse. In the meantime, I'm a religion recovery coach, I help people grapple with life after religion. I am an influencer on the rise and my vocation started with a controversial interview with Josh Harris (Kissed Dating Goodbye, author). I've appeared on several podcasts like Preacher Boys, This Little Light of Mine, Cheers to Leaving, and Divinely Modern. I'm now on a mission to spread awareness of these issues by using social media platforms.Connect with Andrew PledgerLinktreeSupport on PatreonInstagramTikTokTwitterYouTubeWebsite Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.
